Banach spaces, Hahn-Banach

Let XXX be a Banach space and let X∗X^*X∗ be its dual Banach space. Prove that if X∗X^*X∗ is separable then XXX is separable.
Solution.

Let {fn}n⊆X∗\set{f_n}_n \subseteq X^*{fn​}n​⊆X∗ be a countable, dense subset of X∗X^*X∗. For each n≥1n \geq 1n≥1, pick xn∈Xx_n \in Xxn​∈X with ∥xn∥=1\norm{x_n} = 1∥xn​∥=1 such that ∣fn(xn)∣≥12∥fn∥\abs{f_n\p{x_n}} \geq \frac{1}{2}\norm{f_n}∣fn​(xn​)∣≥21​∥fn​∥. We will show that {xn}n\set{x_n}_n{xn​}n​ is dense in XXX.

Suppose otherwise, and that there exists x∈Xx \in Xx∈X such that ∥x−xn∥≥δ\norm{x - x_n} \geq \delta∥x−xn​∥≥δ for some δ>0\delta > 0δ>0. Let M=span⁡{xn∣n≥1}M = \span\set{x_n \mid n \geq 1}M=span{xn​∣n≥1}, which is a linear subspace of HHH. Since xxx has positive distance from MMM, it follows that x∉M‾x \notin \cl{M}x∈/M and so by Hahn-Banach, there exists f∈X∗f \in X^*f∈X∗ such that f(x)=1f\p{x} = 1f(x)=1 and f(xn)=0f\p{x_n} = 0f(xn​)=0 for all n≥1n \geq 1n≥1.

Since {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ is dense in X∗X^*X∗, let {fnk}k\set{f_{n_k}}_k{fnk​​}k​ be a sequence which converges to fff in the operator norm. This means that

∥fnk−f∥≥∣fnk(xnk)−f(xnk)∣=∣fnk(xnk)∣≥12∥fnk∥.\norm{f_{n_k} - f} \geq \abs{f_{n_k}\p{x_{n_k}} - f\p{x_{n_k}}} = \abs{f_{n_k}\p{x_{n_k}}} \geq \frac{1}{2}\norm{f_{n_k}}.∥fnk​​−f∥≥∣fnk​​(xnk​​)−f(xnk​​)∣=∣fnk​​(xnk​​)∣≥21​∥fnk​​∥.

Taking k→∞k \to \inftyk→∞, we see that ∥fnk∥→k→∞0\norm{f_{n_k}} \xrightarrow{k\to\infty} 0∥fnk​​∥k→∞​0, which implies that

∥f∥≤∥f−fnk∥+∥fnk∥→k→∞0.\norm{f} \leq \norm{f - f_{n_k}} + \norm{f_{n_k}} \xrightarrow{k\to\infty} 0.∥f∥≤∥f−fnk​​∥+∥fnk​​∥k→∞​0.

But this implies that f=0f = 0f=0, which is impossible as f(x)=1f\p{x} = 1f(x)=1. Thus, no such xxx could have existed to begin with, so {xn}n\set{x_n}_n{xn​}n​ is a countable, dense subset of XXX.
